summary: Email from psychologist Judith Kuriansky to an individual named Geoff discussing the aftermath of Jeffrey Epstein's death. Kuriansky calls for investigation of the psychologist who cleared Epstein from suicide watch and recommends psychological therapy for victims who recruited friends to Epstein's island. The email includes Kuriansky's extensive professional credentials.

persons.name: Judith Kuriansky
persons.context: Author of the email discussing Epstein's death aftermath, calling for investigation of the psychologist who cleared Epstein from suicide watch and therapy for victims. Lists extensive professional credentials including UN representation and Columbia University professorship.

persons.name: Geoff
persons.context: Recipient of Kuriansky's email about Epstein fallout, though full name and identity are not provided.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Deceased financier and accused sex trafficker
persons.context: Referenced as the subject of the 'mess' following his death, with discussion of his suicide watch clearance and the victims he abused.

persons.name: Sidique Wai
persons.role: Ambassador of Sierra Leone to the USA
persons.context: Mentioned in Kuriansky's credentials as the Ambassador whose advisory board she serves on.

connections.description: Kuriansky serves on the Ambassador's Advisory Board for H.E. Sidique Wai, Ambassador of Sierra Leone to the USA.

events.title: Email about Epstein fallout
events.description: Judith Kuriansky sends email discussing the aftermath of Jeffrey Epstein's death, calling for investigation of the psychologist who cleared him from suicide watch.

events.title: Epstein's death and aftermath
events.description: Reference to Epstein's death and the resulting 'mess,' including concerns about suicide watch clearance and victim recruitment.

locations: Beijing University Health Sciences Center, China
keyFacts: Judith Kuriansky calls for investigation of the psychologist who cleared Jeffrey Epstein from suicide watch prior to his death.
Kuriansky recommends psychological therapy for victims who recruited their friends to join them on trips to Epstein's island.
The email acknowledges that while victims shouldn't be blamed, some did 'drag friends into abuse.'
Kuriansky has extensive professional credentials including UN representation and Columbia University professorship.
The correspondence highlights concerns about institutional failures in Epstein's suicide prevention.
